DOC.detailed_description: Background / Objectives : The optimal dose corticosteroid use intraarticular injection well establish . The objective study compare effectiveness tolerance medium-term small large dose triamcinolone hexacetonide ( TH ) use intraarticular injection ( IAI ) medium size joint patient rheumatoid arthritis ( RA ) . Materials/Methods : A control , randomize , prospective , double-blind study realize patient RA . It evaluate 60 wrist joint ( represent medium size joint ) outpatient clinic Rheumatology Division UNIFESP , Brazil . Inclusion criterion : patient establish RA , age 18 65 year , disease modify anti-rheumatic drug ( DMARDs ) stable least 3 month , synovitis wrist pain visual analogic scale ( VAS ) 4 8cm . Patients overlap syndrome , polyarticular synovitis , diabetes mellitus uncontrolled hypertension suspect local systemic infection exclude . Patients randomize ( Clapboard randomization ) two group 30 patient : group 1 ( high dose ) inject 40mg ( 2ml ) TH group 2 ( small dose ) inject 20mg ( 1ml ) . Only one joint inject patient ( IAI blindly ) . Evaluation conduct blind observer five time : baseline ( T0 ) , one week ( T1 ) , four ( T4 ) , eight ( T8 ) twelve ( T12 ) week follow assessment instrument use : visual analogue scale pain swollen ( VAS 0-10cm ) ; wrist goniometry ; chronic disease activity index ( CDAI ) . Side effect relate event report medical questionnaire . The level statistical significance 5 % .
